texto: processes (3.3), procedures (3.2) and associated resources will be applied by whom and when, to meet the requirements of a specific project (3.5), product (3.4), process or contract NOTE 1 These procedures generally include those referring to quality management processes and to product realization processes. NOTE 2 A quality plan often makes reference to parts of the quality manual or to procedure documents. NOTE 3 A quality plan is generally one of the results of quality planning. 3.9 record document stating results achieved or providing evidence of activities performed NOTE Adapted from ISO 9000:2000, definition 3.7.6 (the Notes have not been included). 3.10 specific case subject of the
